page.title: 01The Area around Duffus
page.content: The block is part of a fetile agricultural region along the south coast of the Moray Firth. It is largely low lying, artificially drained, pasture land - although barley and root vegetables are also grown. The area includes the famous public school, Gordonstown, and part of an important air Base - R.A.F. Lossiemouth. Both these institutions exercise considerable infulence over the area s important employers, consumers and as individual communities. The village of duffus is small and well west with about 200 people. it is served by its own shop/post office and recently opened pub. As well as 2 mobile shops and a mobile library it has a regular bus service to the local town of Elgin and nearby villages. It has a thriving community, based around the church and
